title: Can this toy be compiled VB6 code?
body: Can this toy be compiled VB6 code
author: zyyujq

comments.body: Are you asking if this project can compile VB6 code? The answer is: currently no, **BUT** **it can run VB6 code** via built in interpreter. This is slower than native code compilation, but other than that it does run VB6 code. However, currently it doesn't support all VB6 syntax. More syntax and features might be added in the future. Does it answer you question?

title: Build command for Desktop is wrong
body:
If you clone the repository (via ZIP), and enter it, the given build string for Desktop does not work. I had to edit it to:

"dotnet build AvaloniaVisualBasic.Desktop/AvaloniaVisualBasic.Desktop.csproj"

then it compiled.
author: SuperNerd-James

comments.body: Right, fixed the typo, thanks for reporting!

It's tempting, but unlike VB6 I didn't grow up with this software, so I don't really know, big part of a project like this is nostalgia, so I am afraid this is unlikely to happen. For now I will close the issue, but if anyone ever recreates it, feel free to share it here!
Cheers, my request is nostalgia-based too... a couple of closest are Decker and Cardstock (Python-based).  Thing is, I want want the olden days without the rickets.
